title: 'Ballet of dragon & elephant': China praises PM's 'positive' remarks on bilateral ties
content: China has praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent comments, emphasizing dialogue and cooperation with India. Beijing noted progress in bilateral ties following Modi's meeting with President Xi Jinping and expressed commitment to maintaining stable and healthy relations, highlighting mutual benefits for global peace and prosperity.

title: Watch: NZ PM Luxon leaves PM Modi in splits during joint presser
content: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon humorously referenced recent cricket outcomes during a joint press conference with Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Luxon acknowledged New Zealand’s losses to India and highlighted the strong sporting ties between the countries. Both leaders welcomed a Memorandum of Cooperation on Sports to bolster collaboration.

title: 'Unfortunate govt has to protect Aurangzeb's grave': CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis stated it is unfortunate that the government must protect Aurangzeb's grave amid calls for its removal. He emphasised adherence to legal procedures due to the site's protected status, ensured by the Archaeological Survey of India. Fadnavis lauded Shivaji Maharaj for his role in securing religious freedom.

title: 'Did not self-deport ...': Indian-origin student's lawyer refutes US claim
content: ​Srinivasan's attorney Nathan Yaffe said Kristi Noem's post was false and it showed that they were targeting Srinivasan. "Despite doing nothing wrong, Ms Srinivasan booked a flight out of the country to comply with US law, which gave her a 15-day deadline to depart after DHS illegally terminated her student status," Yaffe said.

title: 'Act against Khalistanis in America': India to US spy chief Tulsi Gabbard
content: Rajnath Singh raised concerns about Khalistani extremists operating on American soil in a meeting with US intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard. They discussed enhancing defence and security ties. The talks also highlighted the activities of the banned Sikh For Justice organization. This meeting follows another between national security advisor Ajit Doval and Gabbard focusing on intelligence sharing.

title: When Indian Babu beat Facebook CEO and others in his team by a simple 'Jugaad'
content: In 2016, an Indian official thwarted Facebook's campaign to save Free Basics by simply opting out of automated emails, according to Sarah Wynn-Williams' memoir. The book alleges Facebook's use of technological and political influence to sway public opinion in India, which ultimately failed as the program was banned for violating net neutrality.

title: NEET PG 2025 exam to be held on June 15
content: The National Board of Examinations (NBEMS) has confirmed that the NEET PG 2025 exam will be held on June 15, 2025. The exam will be conducted in two shifts: 9:00 AM to 12:30 PM and 3:30 PM to 7:00 PM. The internship completion deadline is set for July 31, 2025. Further details, including the full schedule, will be released soon. Aspirants can check the official NBEMS website for more information.

title: No player indispensable, not even Virat Kohli or Rohit Sharma: Gavaskar
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised India's cricket depth after their 2025 Champions Trophy win despite Jasprit Bumrah's absence. He stressed no player, including Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, is indispensable. Highlighting India's resilience and talent pool, Gavaskar noted the team’s strong comeback from a Test defeat to win against England in T20Is and ODIs.

title: Sunita Williams’ joyful photos go viral as she returns after 9 months in Space
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams are returning to Earth after a nine-month mission, extended due to spacecraft issues. Their return became possible with the docking of the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. Videos of Williams joyfully greeting the Crew-10 team have gone viral. The ISS currently hosts 11 members, with Crew-9 soon to return.

title: 'Modi govt robbing public': Kharge slams Centre over petrol prices
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge criticized PM Modi's government for not reducing fuel prices despite a 34% drop in global crude oil prices since 2014, accusing them of burdening the public and fueling inflation. Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri defended the government's policy, citing the benefits of the recently passed Oilfields Amendment Bill.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actress Ranya Rao’s bail plea adjourned till March 19
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao's bail plea in a high-profile gold smuggling case has been adjourned to March 19, with the court requiring the DRI’s objections. Arrested on March 3, 2025, with Rs 12.56 crore worth of gold, Ranya is accused of bypassing airport security using her police connections. The case has implicate influential individuals and intensified political controversy.

title: Elon Musk's ex on hardest part of parenting: I remember being a horror about...
content: Grimes, ex-girlfriend of Elon Musk and mother of his three children, highlights the difficulty of putting kids to bed as the hardest part of parenting. She shares her struggle through a Twitter thread, while also addressing falsely attributed claims about writing on the 'sexuality and kinks' of Fortune 500 CEOs, asserting her lack of control over replicated posts.

title: Watch: Footage shows Rakshit Chaurasiya taking driver’s seat before accident
content: Pranshu Chauhan initially drove the car but later switched seats with Rakshit Chaurasiya, who took over the driver's seat. They left from a friend's residence, with Chaurasiya ultimately driving the car that caused an accident in Karelibaug, killing a woman and injuring seven others. CCTV footage helped reveal these details.

title: India to have ‘world’s longest hyperloop tube soon’: Vaishnaw shares video
content: Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the development of Asia's longest Hyperloop tube at IIT Madras, measuring 410 meters, with plans to become the world's longest soon. His visit to Chennai highlighted India's advancements in indigenously testing Hyperloop technology, with promising results and further development of electronic components at Chennai’s Integral Coach Factory.

title: 'Fadnavis as cruel as Aurangzeb': Cong leader's jab sparks row
content: Maharashtra Congress chief Harshvardhan Sapak compared CM Devendra Fadnavis to Mughal ruler Aurangzeb, sparking political tension. BJP condemned the remark as an 'insult to Maharashtra.' The controversy follows debates on Aurangzeb's tomb and Samajwadi Party MLA Abu Azmi’s praise of Aurangzeb, which led to his suspension from the state assembly.

title: Podcaster Lex Fridman decodes how PM Modi manages crazy work hours daily
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's motivation and dedication stem from the hard work he witnesses around him and his sense of responsibility to his country. He emphasizes serving the nation and adhering to principles of hard work, good intentions, and selfless service. His leadership inspires continuous effort and commitment.

title: 'Pay now or get arrested': Inside the growing menace of digital arrest scams
content: Digital arrest scams trick people into providing personal and financial information by preying on their fear, urgency and authority perception. Scammers pose as officials using firm tones and spoofed numbers. They create panic and confusion, manipulating victims. Awareness and skepticism are crucial to avoid falling into this trap. Ignoring such calls is advised.

title: Are star kids judged too harshly? Ibrahim-Khushi trolled for 'Nadaaniyan'
content: The release of the Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor starrer 'Nadaaniyaan' has sparked significant backlash and harsh criticism from the audience. Discussing the challenges faced by star kids due to nepotism and preparedness, industry experts emphasize the need for better training, support, and focus on the craft rather than glamor.

title: 'We will continue to fall ...': Inzamam criticises PCB over decline in performance
content: Inzamam-ul-Haq has raised concerns over the decline in Pakistan cricket, attributing it to poor decision-making and frequent changes in the PCB. He emphasised the need for a proper strategy and consistent planning to improve performance. Inzamam also supported Babar Azam, urging the board to trust the management and players to address issues collaboratively.

title: Cows possess magnetic power that wards off germs: Punjab governor Kataria
content: Punjab Governor Gulab Chand Kataria emphasized the importance of cow conservation in India and praised PM Narendra Modi for tackling political corruption. Speaking at the foundation of Tulsi Gaushala, he highlighted the historical reverence for cows and called for renewed efforts and research in cow welfare.

title: BJP MLA T Raja Singh resolves to make India 'Hindu Rashtra'
content: BJP MLA T Raja Singh called for the removal of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb's tomb in Maharashtra, asserting his aim to make India a 'Hindu Rashtra.' He echoed sentiments of various groups demanding the tomb's demolition, likening it to a 'poisonous sword.' Congress leaders criticized the demand, stressing it disrupts peace and hinders the state's development.

title: Will Bitcoin price crash to $20,000? Peter Schiff makes prediction
content: Peter Schiff warns that Bitcoin could crash to $20,000 if the Nasdaq enters a bear market. He emphasizes the historical correlation between Bitcoin and Nasdaq declines, while also pointing out gold’s potential rise as an alternative safe haven.

title: Abu Qatal killed — Could 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed be the next target?
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Abu Qatal's killing in Pakistan has dealt a significant blow to the group, potentially paving the way for targeting LeT mastermind Hafiz Saeed next. Defence experts stress the need for ongoing counterterrorism measures and suggest that high-level intelligence efforts are closing in on Saeed.

title: 'Overspeeding for enjoyment': Survivor recalls Vadodara car crash horror
content: A tragic car accident in Vadodara, Gujarat, resulted in the death of a woman and injuries to eight others. Witnesses claim the driver, Rakshit Ravish Chaurasia, appeared intoxicated and was over-speeding. Chaurasia, now in custody, denies being drunk and attributes the accident to losing control after the airbag deployed. Victims demand strict action.

title: 'Will work together against terrorism': PM Modi after talks with NZ PM Luxon
content: Prime Minister Modi and his New Zealand counterpart Christopher Luxon addressed a joint press conference in Delhi, highlighting agreements and discussions on bilateral relations, defence, security, migration, and terrorism. Modi emphasized their shared commitments in the Indo-Pacific and the strong sports ties between the two countries. They agreed to celebrate 100 years of sports relationship in 2026.

title: India's Got Latent row: Samay Raina gets second summons from Maharashtra cyber cell
content: Maharashtra Cyber Cell summons comedian and YouTuber Samay Raina to record a statement regarding the controversial 'India's Got Latent' show, due to his absence in previous summons. The controversy began after inappropriate comments made by podcaster Ranveer Allahbadia, leading to FIRs and Supreme Court intervention. Raina expressed regret and removed all show videos from his channel.

title: TASMAC scam sparks protests in Tamil Nadu; BJP leaders detained: Key details
content: A political conflict erupted in Tamil Nadu after the Enforcement Directorate claimed evidence of corruption within TASMAC. The BJP organized a protest, leading to the arrest of several opposition leaders. However, the DMK government has strongly refuted the allegations, denying any malpractices in TASMAC operations.

title: 'Did it as he abused Islam': Pakistani don Shehzab Bhatti on Jalandhar grenade attack
content: Pakistan-based don Shahzad Bhatti released a video claiming responsibility for a grenade attack on social media influencer Rozer Sandhu's house in Jalandhar. The device, which didn't explode, was found by police officials. Bhatti warned of further attacks if Sandhu continued to disrespect Islam. Jalandhar police are investigating the incident and examining the suspicious object.

title: At US airports, elderly green card holders face pressure to give it up
content: Immigration attorneys report an increase in the secondary inspection and detention of green card holders by the US Custom and Border Protection (CBP), particularly targeting elderly Indian residents. Attorneys advise against surrendering green cards at the airport, stressing the importance of a hearing before an immigration judge.

title: Over 57% of men lack vitamin B12: 6 diet tips to boost levels
content: A recent study highlights that over 57% of male corporate employees in India suffer from vitamin B12 deficiency, with nearly 50% of women also exhibiting low levels. Vitamin B12 deficiency is a growing concern among Indian men, particularly corporate employees with demanding work schedules. Prioritize your nutrition today to stay energized, focused, and healthy!

title: Why Mumbai residents are up against Rs 229 crore jetty near Gateway of India
content: Colaba residents urge legislative assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar to halt the Rs 229-crore passenger jetty and terminal project at Radio Club near the Gateway of India. Their concerns include heritage impacts, traffic congestion, and environmental imbalances, urging feasibility checks before proceeding.

title: Trump shares PM Modi's podcast with Lex Fridman
content: US President Trump acknowledged the strength of India-US relations by sharing PM Modi's podcast praising him. Modi highlighted Trump's support during the 2019 'Howdy Modi' event and appreciated Trump's leadership stance. Trump also recently addressed India's high tariff rates amid trade negotiations.

title: Do deep-sea nodules produce oxygen in the dark? Experts debate new findings
content: A scientific debate has emerged regarding the possibility of producing 'dark oxygen' without sunlight, through metallic nodules found deep in the ocean. The discovery challenges long-held beliefs about life's origins but faces skepticism and criticism from other scientists and the funding firm.

title: 59 Delhi-Bengaluru trips in 6 months: Two South Africans held with Rs 75 crore MDMA
content: CCB sleuths of Mangaluru City police arrested two South African women in Bengaluru and seized nearly 38kg MDMA worth Rs 75 crore. The suspects reportedly flew between Bengaluru and New Delhi 59 times in six months to deliver the drugs. The arrested are identified as Bamba Fanta and Abigail Adonis.

title: Sunita Williams shares what she will 'miss' most about space ahead of Earth return
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are preparing to return to Earth after spending nine months on the ISS. Technical issues with Boeing’s Starliner delayed their return. The recently launched SpaceX Crew-10 mission will facilitate their journey back. The astronauts continued important research and station maintenance during their extended stay.

title: 'Was a gift': French politician calls for return of the Statue of Liberty from US
content: France should reclaim the Statue of Liberty as the US no longer upholds its original values, says Euro-deputy Raphael Glucksmann. He criticises President Trump's policy changes, including firing researchers and siding with tyrants. Glucksmann urges America to return the gift and invites dismissed researchers to work in France.

title: Odia poet, ex-bureaucrat Ramakanta Rath passes away at 91
content: Ramakanta Rath, eminent poet and Padma Bhushan awardee, passed away at 91 in Bhubaneswar. He was a celebrated figure in Odia literature and a former bureaucrat. Chief minister Mohan Charan Majhi and others mourned his loss, highlighting his literary and administrative contributions. Rath's notable works and accolades include the Saraswati Samman and Sahitya Akademi Award.

title: Amritsar temple attack: Key assailant killed in police encounter, one escapes
content: One of the assailants involved in the attack on Thakurdwara temple in Amritsar was killed during an encounter with Punjab police. The attack on the temple resulted in significant damage but no fatalities. The deceased was identified as Gursidak Singh, and his accomplice Vishal escaped. The police continue to pursue the remaining suspect.

title: The reason behind Lex Fridman’s 45-hour fast before his podcast with PM Modi
content: During the interview, PM Modi discussed the significance of fasting in Indian culture, its spiritual and scientific aspects, and how it enhances sensory perception and discipline. The conversation also touched on PM Modi's vision for the nation.

title: TN BJP chief Annamalai, ex-governor Tamilisai Soundararajan arrested in Chennai
content: BJP state president K Annamalai was arrested by Chennai police while heading to Egmore for a protest against the TASMAC scam. Former Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan and other senior party leaders were also detained. Police blocked the residences of BJP state and district office-bearers from 7 am onwards, arresting them as soon as they attempted to leave for the protest.

title: Explained: Player replacement rules in IPL 2025
content: The IPL has expanded its player replacement policy, allowing teams to replace players facing season-ending injuries or illnesses till the season's 12th league fixture. Here's an explainer on what the rule specifically says.

title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: The bracket is set. Here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Your guide to all 68 teams in the men’s NCAA tournament
content: The bracket is set, here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Bengals reach extensions with Chase, Higgins
content: The Bengals have secured two of the NFL's most prominent wide receivers, with Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins telling Fox Sports that they have agreed to contract extensions.

title: Auburn, Duke top men's NCAA field; SEC gets 14
content: Overall top seed Auburn was joined by Duke, Houston and Florida as 1-seeds, and a record 14 teams from the SEC were selected to participate in the NCAA tournament.

title: UCLA lands NCAA's No. 1 overall women's seed
content: UCLA, South Carolina and Texas, who all had a turn at No. 1 this season in the Associated Press poll, joined USC on Sunday as the top seeds in the women's NCAA basketball tournament, which will begin this week and conclude with the Final Four in Tampa.

title: Scheyer: Goal for Flagg to play in Friday opener
content: Duke coach Jon Scheyer told ESPN that the goal is for star freshman Cooper Flagg to play in Friday's first-round game following his ankle injury.

title: Betts (illness) out for Tokyo Series; lost 15 pounds
content: Dodgers shortstop Mookie Betts will not play in the two-game Tokyo Series against the Cubs because of an illness that's lingered for the past week.

title: IOC recommends boxing in L.A. 2028 Games
content: The International Olympic Committee executive board on Monday recommended the inclusion of boxing in the 2028 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, ending a years-long saga regarding the sport's Olympic future.

title: Messi back in starting lineup, scores in Miami win
content: Substitute Fafà Picault scored for Inter Miami CF in the 89th minute, and Lionel Messi scored for the first time this MLS regular season in a dramatic, late 2-1 victory at Atlanta United FC on Sunday.

title: Andreeva stops Sabalenka for Indian Wells title
content: Russian teenager Mirra Andreeva fought back to overcome world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka 2-6, 6-4, 6-3 in the Indian Wells final Sunday.

title: Lunardi: The one big thing the selection committee got wrong
content: After genuinely consistent selections in the NET era, the committee's decision to include both Texas and North Carolina has stumped our resident Bracketologist.

title: 'It was about putting together the best team': How Duke built a roster to complement Cooper Flagg
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: MLB's villains or its gold standard? How the Los Angeles Dodgers got here
content: Love them or loathe them, the defending champs built a new evil empire with a series of monumental moves.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from non-league has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: Monterrey's Sergio Ramos gets 30th career red
content: Sergio Ramos was sent off in the final minutes of Monterrey's victory over UNAM on Sunday, his first dismissal since he moved to Liga MX.

title: Fernandes on Keane criticism: It motivates me
content: Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes said he has plenty of respect for Roy Keane but he wants to do things in his own way.

title: Antonio vows to return to football after car crash
content: West Ham United forward Michail Antonio has insisted he will play professional football again after he recovers from being involved in a near-fatal road traffic collision in December.

title: Sources: Casadó (knee) to miss rest of season
content: Marc Casadó is likely to miss the rest of the season after injuring knee ligaments in Sunday's 4-2 win over Atlético Madrid, sources have told ESPN.

title: Slot: 'Hunger' not the issue in Liverpool cup loss
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot dismissed the idea Newcastle United's players were "hungrier" in Sunday's Carabao Cup final, but admitted Eddie Howe's side were deserved winners.

title: Source: Pulisic in talks over new AC Milan deal
content: United States national team star Christian Pulisic is in negotiations with AC Milan over a new contract, a source has told ESPN.

title: City's Gonzalez echoes Pep: All games now finals
content: Manchester City have got "nine finals" left in the Premier League to make sure they qualify for next season's Champions League, midfielder Nico Gonzalez has said.

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Men's first-round betting odds, lines, spread and BPI
content: Every set of betting lines, spreads, totals and more betting odds for the first round of the 2025 men's NCAA tournament.

title: Destiny's Child's 'Say My Name' leads trends since last time Kansas wasn't a top-four seed in March Madness
content: The Kansas Jayhawks enter the NCAA Tournament seeded outside of the top-four for the first time since 2000.

title: NHL playoff watch: The Bruins' path to the postseason
content: It's a long shot, but the B's can still pull this off -- here's how. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: With Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins extended, what's next for Bengals, Trey Hendrickson?
content: What's a good return on investment for the Bengals' huge offensive dollars? Is there enough remaining to sign Hendrickson?

title: Josh  Berry gets first career Cup Series win at Vegas
content: Josh Berry raced to the first Cup Series victory of his career, taking NASCAR's oldest team to victory lane Sunday at Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea keeping tabs on Thuram
content: Chelsea and Arsenal have joined the race for Inter Milan star Marcus Thuram. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: "Ballet Dance Between Dragon, Elephant": China Reacts To PM's Comments
content: The mutual respect between New Delhi and Beijing is openly on display. The latest being Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "positive" remarks on the ties between the two countries, which China has "appreciated".

title: How An Anonymous Letter Exposed UP Teacher's Abuse Of Students
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Hathras are looking for the suspended Chief Proctor of a college, who faces serious allegations of sexually abusing students and recording the acts to blackmail them.

title: US Intelligence Chief's 'Islamic Caliphate' Remark On Crisis In Bangladesh
content: The United States is deeply concerned about the situation in Bangladesh, US Intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard told NDTV World today, speaking about the persecution of religious minorities.

title: India Flags Khalistani Terror, Sikhs For Justice In Talks With Tulsi Gabbard
content: India on Monday urged the United States to act against banned Khalistani terror group Sikhs for Justice - which operates from American soil - and its founder, US-based lawyer Gurpatwant Pannun.

title: Biden Faces Uncertainty As Trump Declares Presidential Pardons "Null, Void"
content: Former US President Joe Biden faces uncertainty after his successor Donald Trump has declared that Biden's last-minute presidential pardons, including one to his son Hunter Biden, are "null and void".

title: Vadodara Crash Accused Swapped Seats With Friend: What New Footage Shows
content: Rakshit Chaurasia, the accused in the Vadodara crash that left a woman dead and seven others injured, may have insisted that he would drive the car and convinced his friend Pranshu to shift to the seat next to the driver, CCTV footage shows

title: 2 Women Journalists Arrested For Post Against Revanth Reddy Get Bail
content: Two women journalists who were arrested earlier this month for allegedly circulating "abusive" content against Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy have secured bail today.

title: This Government Bond Made Investors Rich By Nearly 200% In 8 Years
content: Investors in the Sovereign Gold Bond (SGB) 2016-17 Series IV and 2019-20 Series IV are set for significant returns, with the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announcing the final redemption price.

title: PCB Suffers Rs 869 Crore Loss In Champions Trophy, Takes Drastic Measures
content: The PCB has reportedly suffered an 85 percent loss on their investment in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

title: "Hafiz Saeed May Face Similar Fate": Expert As Nephew Killed In Pakistan
content: Abu Qatal, the nephew of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks mastermind Hafiz Saeed and a handler in several terror strikes in India, was killed in Pakistan.

title: Minister Shares Video Of India's Hyperloop Tube, Set To Be "World's Longest"
content: The 410-meter-long Hyperloop test tube located at IIT Chennai is already the longest Hyperloop test facility in Asia.

title: Opinion: Aamir Khan @60: Caught In His Own 'Cage'
content: Aamir Khan, an actor who once took pride in doing things differently, now finds himself pigeonholed in a cage of his own making, bound by the expectations of his fan base.

title: Mumbai Indians Star Breaches Pak Contract To Join IPL, Gets Legal Notice
content: The PCB management has also outlined the repercussions of his departure from the league and expects his response within the stipulated time frame.

title: "Hamas Never Stopped Digging": Ex Hostage's Big Revelation On Gaza Tunnels
content: Hamas continues to expand its vast underground tunnel network in Gaza, a released Israeli hostage has revealed.

title: Opinion: How Serious Is Pakistan's 'Internal Meltdown'?
content: Pakistan faces a grave miscalculation in Balochistan. Whether it acknowledges it or not, the situation demands more than just brute force - it requires a fundamental shift in strategy.

title: 'Dark Oxygen': A Deep-Sea Discovery That Has Split Scientists
content: Could lumpy metallic rocks in the deepest, darkest reaches of the ocean be making oxygen in the absence of sunlight?

title: Women's bracket winners, losers and the path ahead for JuJu Watkins and Paige Bueckers﻿
content: the Bruins have reached the 30-win mark for the first time in program history . they are hoping to make their first final four in the NCAA era . the top seeds are split between the Big Ten and the SEC .

title: NFL experts debate free agency: Which team made the best signing or trade?
content: free agency has started to slow down since officially opening on monday . some teams have made splash signings, adding standouts like Sam Darnold , Davante Adams , Justin Fields , Josh Sweat and Carlton Davis III to their roster . the best overall signing, re-signing or trade of free agency?

title: Sergio Ramos sent off again! His 30 career red cards, from Real Madrid to Monterrey
content: Sergio Ramos has the all-time laLiga record for red cards (20) while playing for real madrid . the 38-year-old has picked up another four red cards during his late-career stints with Paris Saint-Germain , sevilla and now Liga MX club Monterrey .

title: How does Josh Allen getting paid affect the rest of the Bills?
content: the most significant move the Buffalo Bills will make this offseason was addressed last Sunday . the deal ended with a meeting between quarterback Josh Allen and general manager Brandon Beane . it ended with the Bills giving Allen a six-year extension, overriding the four years he had left on his contract .

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: Norris' narrow Australian GP win over Verstappen belies McLaren dominance
content: Lando Norris wins the first race of the season in Melbourne . the 0.8-second winning margin over Max Verstappen belied the performance of his McLaren MCL39 . norris' old friend and persistent foe was tucked right under his rear wing .

title: Landowners are standing with ‘begging bowls’ to recover ₹1,557.61 crore, laments Madras High Court
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh finds an astounding amount of compensation yet to be paid in land acquisition cases across Tamil Nadu and Puducherry

title: Integrated bus terminus at Panjapur nearing completion
content: Final stage work on bus bays, passenger waiting rooms, sanitation complexes, pathways for persons with disabilities, and the installation of surveillance cameras, LED screens and lights, display boards, and air conditioning are under way

title: I am responsible for my defeat, nobody defeated me in the past, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: TDP lost the elections earlier since he did not pay attention to strengthening the party and cadre, replies Naidu in response to a question raised by a TDP MLA in the Assembly

title: Finance Minister Thennarasu defends government’s borrowings, says they are being spent on capex, public welfare
content: The Finance Minister reiterates that the borrowings are well within the stipulated limit. The borrowsings under the DMK government since 2021 had been lower than those under the AIADMK government, he points out

title: Three-day millet mela from March 22 in Anantapur
content: The mela is being organised by the Anantha Susthira Vyavasaya Vedika and the Indian Institute of Millet Research, Agricultural Research Station

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar meets his counterparts from Sweden, Ireland
content: The interactions took place on a day when the three-day Raisina Dialogue — India's premier conference on geopolitics and geoeconomics — began in New Delhi

title: CPI(M) cadre, residents stage protest seeking service roads along Tiruchi-Thanjavur highway
content: The protesters condemned the delay in building the service roads between Palpannai and Thuvakudi on the highway and called for swift land acquisition and execution of the project

title: Pinarayi Vijayan dismisses Opposition’s allegations on breakfast meeting with Nirmala Sitharaman
content: Senior Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala had challenged the CM to reveal the details of his conversation with Nirmala Sitharaman and accused the CPI(M) of secretly aligning with the BJP.

title: The women’s March Madness bracket is here -- so is your guide to all 68 teams
content: the bracket is set, and 68 teams are going dancing in the women's NCAA tournament . defending champion south Carolina to first-timer George Mason are in the bracket . there's no clear-cut favorite -- a fitting end to this riveting season full of star power .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: TTD to accept recommendation letters of public representatives of Telangana from March 24
content: In accordance with the decision, the letters for VIP darshan will be accepted twice a week, on Sunday and Monday, for the darshan on Monday and Tuesday

title: MEA constituted 'gender budget cell': Govt to parliamentary panel
content: The cell has been tasked with evaluating gender-related contributions of projects implemented by the Ministry of External Affairs

title: 19 Maoists surrender before security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district
content: The cadres turned themselves in citing disappointment with "hollow" and "inhuman" Maoist ideology, exploitation of innocent tribals by senior cadres and differences brewing within the outlawed outfit

title: AIMIM walks out of assembly charging Treasury Benches with failing to effectively conduct business
content: AIMIM floor leader Akbaruddin Owaisi expresses concern over delays in receiving the assembly agenda and abrupt closure of Question Hour on Monday

title: Telangana’s green energy policy attracts significant investments: Bhatti
content: Deputy Chief Minister emphasizes that the government aims to generate 20,000 MW of green energy by 2030 from the present 8,938 MW generation capacity, and 40,000 MW by 2040.

title: Rajya Sabha MPs flag poor train amenities, call for better services
content: MPs debate overcrowding, safety, and maintenance issues in Indian Railways, calling for improved services and accessibility for passengers.

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Parliamentary panel suggests formulation of comprehensive foreign policy strategy tailored to India's context
content: Parliamentary panel recommends tailored foreign policy strategy for India’s global stature, emphasizing geopolitical context, economic clout, and global relationships

title: Former Union Minister Debendra Pradhan dies at 84; President, Prime Minister mourn
content: Pradhan, the three-time Odisha BJP president, breathed his last at his son's official residence at Teen Murti Lane in New Delhi.

title: Environmentalists, seers to stage protest in Shivamogga against Sharavati Pumped Storage project on March 19
content: Abhinava Channabasava Mahaswamy of Mulegadde mutt at Hosanagara and Basava Marulasidda Swamy of Basava Kendra in Shivamogga are among those expected to take part in the protest

title: BCI warns against legal misinformation, bans influencer promotions
content: The BCI also issued a “stringent warning” against the increasingly prevalent and unethical practice of advocates advertising their legal services

title: Intruder spent over 90 minutes inside BJP MP DK Aruna’s residence in Hyderabad, no property loss reported
content: Police teams, including eight special units, are reviewing CCTV footage and examining the routes used by the intruder

title: Scheduled Castes to be divided into three groups to implement 15% reservation
content: Assembly passes Telangana Scheduled Castes (Rationalisation of Reservations) Bill on Monday adhering to provisions of Apex Court’s judgment

title: Mandya DC visits MIMS to inquire about health of students undergoing treatment for food poisoning
content: Students of a private educational institution at T. Kagepura in Malavalli taluk were among scores of people who had taken ill after consuming the food prepared at a feast in connection with Holi festivities on March 14

title: Team arrives at Tuticorin Thermal Power Station to inspect fire damage
content: A major fire had broken out at TTPS on Saturday, which led to the shutdown of three units with a total capacity of 630 MW

title: Supreme Court stays CBI probe against former Tamil Nadu Minister Rajenthra Bhalaji
content: The court said the Tamil Nadu Governor, on receiving translated documents, must ‘forthwith’ take a decision on sanction to prosecute the former Minister under the Prevention of Corruption Act

title: J&K Police orders inquiry into officer's conduct against woman protester in Kulgam
content: “Shocking & unbecoming for a policeman to kick a woman only because she was peacefully protesting against the mysterious deaths in Devsar Kulgam”, PDP leader Iltija Mufti posted on X

title: Telangana renames PSR Telugu University as Suravaram Pratapa Reddy university
content: Assembly passes Bill renaming the varsity after Telangana’s veteran freedom fighter and littérateur

title: Steel Ministry Secretary to discuss revival of Visakhapatnam Steel Plant with Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu on March 31
content: On the release of Central funds to VSP, Industries & Commerce Minister T.G. Bharat said the first tranche of ₹6,783 crore has already been released on January 30, 2025

title: ‘Beware Revanth Reddy’, ‘VC down down’ slogans rock OU Arts College; students demand circular prohibiting protests be rolled back
content: The univ in a clarification stated that the said prohibitive order does not impose a blanket ban on protests but only bans protests in administrative and academic spaces

title: Ruling Congress, BJP members spar over tax devolution, fund allocation for development, use of SC, ST funds for guarantees in Karnataka
content: Even as the Chief Minister defended the successful implementation of the five guarantees, BJP members claimed that the government’s borrowings increased and development has come to a standstill owing to the welfare schemes

title: Ensure gender parity of athletes in events: Delhi High Court to Sports Ministry
content: Justice Sachin Datta directed the Union Sports Ministry to ensure that the pool of participating athletes was "broad enough" to include not only the athletes who had participated in international events but it must also adequately accommodate those who participated in domestic or local or Khelo India sporting events

title: CM Stalin releases book documenting T.N.’s financial management from Sangam Age
content: He also launched a special webpage, https://www.tamildigitallibrary.in/budget, which will host the book

title: Participation of elephants in festivals is part of our culture: Supreme Court
content: The Bench, however, did not agree with an application filed by two devaswoms seeking a transfer of the case from the Kerala High Court to the Supreme Court itself

title: Bills enhancing BC reservations to 42% passed in Telangana Assembly; legislations need Centre’s approval
content: The process to enhance the reservations in education, employment and local body polls was set in motion by Telangana Govt

title: Rajya Sabha member asks for national school transport policy for school vehicles including buses and vans
content: "This policy should mandate seat belts, CCTVs, and GPS (in school transport vehicles). Regulations must extend to private schools and transport options such as auto, vans and rickshaws ensuring a defined set of safety standards is applied," she said

title: Manipur violence: Cases to be tried in Guwahati itself, says Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court extends panel’s tenure overseeing Manipur ethnic violence cases, directs trials to be held in Guwahati.

title: TAFE appoints Lakshmi Venu as Vice Chairman
content: Ms. Lakshmi’s contributions have earned her several accolades, including being recognized as one of Business Today’s “Most Powerful Women in Business” in 2023, according to a release

title: Express trains coming to Visakhapatnam delayed as girder damaged after reportedly being hit by truck
content: According to reports, the truck hit the girder, placed on the road to prevent the movement of heavy vehicles on the road underbridge, breaking the girder

title: Kerala ASHA workers to go on indefinite hunger strike from March 20
content: Kerala ASHA Health Workers’ Association leaders say they will continue agitation till their main demands for increased honorarium and retirement benefits are met by government

title: MGNREGA jobs: Screening through retina scans attack on veil culture, says Rajasthan MP Rajkumar Roat
content: The Bharat Adivasi Party MP said the new norms introduced in the last five years will weaken the employment scheme

title: PM Modi-Christopher Luxon meeting: India, New Zealand ink defence pact
content: PM Modi and New Zealand PM Luxon discuss strengthening bilateral ties, focusing on trade, defense, education, and agriculture cooperation.

title: Sukhu presents ₹58,514 crore Himachal Pradesh Budget
content: Focused on the rural economy and ‘making the State self-reliant’, the Congress Chief Minister criticised the BJP-led Central govt., and said Himachal Pradesh had been ‘consistently neglected from an economic perspective’

title: VCK will ask for more seats in 2026 Assembly election, says Thol. Thirumavalavan
content: There is no question of moving out of the alliance to another one that offers more seats, he emphasised

title: Sonia, Mamata among those who inquired about my health: V-P Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: Mr. Dhankhar said he was "greatly touched" by the concerns expressed across party lines which contributed to his speedy recovery

title: AIADMK’s no-confidence motion against Speaker Appavu defeated in T.N. Assembly
content: Expelled AIADMK leader Panneerselvam and senior AIAIDMK leader Sengottaiyan, who is in the news for his reported differences with the party leadership, also voted in favour of the motion

title: Six sites added to India's tentative list by UNESCO's World Heritage Centre, says Gajendra Singh Shekhawat in Lok Sabha
content: With these additions, India now has 62 sites on the tentative list, an inventory of properties each country intends to consider for UNESCO nomination

title: Supreme Court seeks Centre's reply on PIL challenging current CAG appointment procedure
content: The PIL sought direction of the court mandating that the CAG shall be appointed by the President in consultation with an independent and neutral selection committee comprising of the PM, the Leader of the Opposition and the Chief Justice of India

title: Sacrifice of many freedom fighters intentionally erased, says Culture Minister
content: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said in the Lok Sabha that the Narendra Modi government has remembered and honoured all freedom fighters of the country through Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, which was celebrated across the country

title: Kerala Police has prepared list of repeat offenders in drug cases, says Minister
content: M.B. Rajesh submits list of 497 repeat offenders in NDPS cases and 500 repeat offenders in abkari cases, along with the number of cases in which each is an accused

title: Kerala Minister hints at amendment to ragging Act with stricter provisions
content: R. Bindu tells Assembly that anti-ragging committees had been formed in all higher education institutions as per the UGC Regulations on Curbing the Menace of Ragging in Higher Educational Institutions, 2009

title: Delhi airport operator sues government over flights from defence airbase
content: Delhi airport will become ‘economically and financially unviable,’ after the government permitted commercial flights from the defence airbase in Ghaziabad, Delhi International Airport Limited said in the March 10 lawsuit

title: Tiger shot dead in Kerala’s Idukki after attacking forest official during capture attempt
content: Tiger had strayed into human habitations at Granby near Vandiperiyar in Idukki and was in the area for past two weeks

title: Sacred Trails: Telangana tourists flock to Madhya Pradesh’s temples and heritage sites
content: Given the varied demands of tourists, we are focusing on customised packages, designed on basis of — number of tourists, duration of stay, times of visit and mode of transport — we can assure visitors of affordable accommodations at our hotels and resorts, explains an official of the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board

title: More pain for Atleti as Barça strike pivotal LaLiga title blow
content: a 92nd-minute strike from Ferran Torres puts atlético ahead in the 45th minute . the result catapults Barcelona to the top of the laLiga table on 60 points . atletico are four points behind the pair .

title: ASHA workers lay siege to Secretariat in Kerala, step up agitation
content: Life comes to a standstill along arterial MG Road in Kerala capital as thousands of ASHAs from across the State blockade front gate of Secretariat

title: Quashing of Munambam judicial commission’s appointment plunges land issue into further legal complications
content: Though Kerala government, represented by its Advocate General, keenly contested the petition of the Kerala Waqf Land Samrakshana Vedi for the dissolution of Mr. Nair’s appointment before Kerala High Court, the court found merit in the contentions of Vedi and ruled in its favour

title: Influencer Orry, 7 others booked for ‘consuming alcohol’ at J&K’s Vaishno Devi pilgrimage base camp
content: The FIR was registered against the eight for “violating the law of the land” and a team was set up to nab them for “hurting the sentiments of people”

title: Modi speaking Trump's language: Congress on PM's remarks on global organisations
content: He also addressed the relevance of global organisations like the United Nations, noting that their inability to evolve with the times has sparked a global debate on their relevance

title: 1,343 cases registered in Kerala CSR funds scam, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Responding to questions, Pinarayi tells Kerala Assembly that accused collected ₹281.43 crore from 49,386 people

title: Control rooms and helpline centres opened in Yadgir to attend to drinking water crisis in the district
content: Zilla panchayat CEO has directed the nodal officers and officers deployed at helpline centres not to avoid a single call on water crises

title: Accused looked ‘intoxicated’, was overspeeding for ‘enjoyment,’ says victim of Vadodara car accident
content: Vikas Kewalani, the victim of the car accident, demanded strict actions against the accused, stating that they will realise their mistakes only when strict punishment is taken against them

title: Munambam land issue: Kerala High Court quashes appointment of Ramachandran Nair commission
content: Court observes that as the issue is still pending before Waqf Tribunal, even if the dispute creates any issues of public order, recourse to Provisions of the Commission of Inquiry Act could not have been resorted to at this stage

title: Security forces seize firearms in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: Police also said that intelligence-based combing operations and cordon and search operations are being carried out in both hill and valley districts to recover all the looted and illegal weapons in the State

title: Tamil Nadu BJP leaders, including Annamalai and Tamilisai, arrested ahead of protest at Tasmac headquarters
content: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Annamalai was taken into custody near Neelangarai as he was proceeding towards the protest venue in Egmore

title: Maharana Pratap descendant Arvind Singh Mewar dies at 81
content: He is survived by wife Vijayraj Kumari, son Lakshyaraj Singh Mewar and daughters Bhargavi Kumari Mewar and Padmaja Kumari Parmar.

title: Amritsar temple blast suspect killed in exchange of fire with Punjab Police
content: The blast occurred outside the Thakur Dwara Temple on March 15 when a person hurled an explosive device towards it, damaging a portion of its wall and shattering window panes

title: Gold worth ₹8.47 crore seized at Mumbai airport; three staffers among five held
content: “The seizures were made between March 13-15 and some of the accused had concealed the precious metal in their clothes and undergarments,” officials said

title: Justice Bagchi sworn in as SC judge, in line to be CJI in 2031
content: Justice Bagchi would take over the office of the CJI in May 2031 and continue till his retirement on October 2, 2031

title: Is government ready to discuss voter ID issue, asks Trinamool’s Derek O’Brien as Parliament resumes after break
content: "Parliament gets back to work after a four day break. A constructive Opposition wants to debate an issue that is at the core of democracy. Is the Government ready?" Derek O'Brien said

title: Construction of road on Bhima bridge completed
content: In another major repair work to reconstruct the shoulder part of the railway bridge, which is adjacent to the Bhima river bridge, was also completed at a cost of ₹ 1 crore

title: Police arrests student for namaz in open area of university in Meerut
content: The student was arrested following protests by local Hindu groups over a purported video surfaced around Holi celebrations this week that showed a group of students offering namaz on the university campus

title: Palaniswami seeks solatium for man, who died while waiting for darshan ticket in Tiruchendur temple
content: Criticising the government, he alleged inaction on the part of Minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments for the man’s death

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 4 LIVE Updates: ‘Railways has recovered losses due to COVID-19’, says Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Demands for Grants under the control of the Ministry of Railways for 2025-26 being discussed in Lok Sabha
